selected_quotes: Reading M Babu's + realising his 2016 Royal Society Medal @mrc_l…
Reading M Babu's + realising his 2016 Royal Society Medal @mrc_lmb GREAT + CONGRATS !

citation.abstract: G protein-coupled receptors (GPCRs) allosterically activate heterotrimeric G proteins and trigger GDP release. Given that there are ∼800 human GPCRs and 16 different Gα genes, this raises the question of whether a universal allosteric mechanism governs Gα activation. Here we show that different GPCRs interact with and activate Gα proteins through a highly conserved mechanism. Comparison of Gα with the small G protein Ras reveals how the evolution of short segments that undergo disorder-to-order transitions can decouple regions important for allosteric activation from receptor binding specificity. This might explain how the GPCR-Gα system diversified rapidly, while conserving the allosteric activation mechanism.
citation.title: Universal allosteric mechanism for G[alpha] activation by GPCRs
